title: Boy, 4, Rescued After Nearly 22 Hours Alone in California Woods
text:
Human Interest Human Interest News Boy, 4, Rescued After Nearly 22 Hours Wandering Alone in California Woods: 'Family Got Lucky' Christian Ramirez was found under a tree near Huntington Lake on Friday, June 21
By Gabrielle Rockson Gabrielle Rockson Gabrielle Rockson is a staff writer-reporter for PEOPLE. She joined PEOPLE in 2023 and covers entertainment and human interest stories. She's interviewed David Beckham, Zendaya, Timothée Chalamet and many others. Her previous work can be found in OK! Magazine, MyLondon, GRM Daily, and more.
People Editorial Guidelines Published on June 24, 2024 08:08AM EDT Close Christian Ramirez was found safe in the woods on Friday, June 21, 2024. Photo: Fresno County Sheriff's Office
A four-year-old boy who disappeared from a California campground has been found almost a day after he went missing in Fresno County.
On Friday, June 21, the Fresno County Sheriff’s Office confirmed in a statement that Christian Ramirez had been found by members of the Tulare County Search and Rescue Team.
Ramirez, who was rescued around a “quarter mile away” from where he was reported missing, was described as being in good condition but tired and hungry. He has since been reunited with his parents.
In a video shared by the Sheriff’s Office, the little boy was carried by a member of the rescue team while holding onto a sandwich.

Christian Ramirez found safe in the woods on Friday, June 21. Fresno County Sheriff's Office
4 Missing Divers Found Floating Less Than 50 Miles from Cape Fear, N.C., Coast Guard Says “After missing for 22 hours, search and rescue team members found Christian Ramirez nestled under a tree near Huntington Lake,” the Sheriff’s Office wrote. “He was hungry and exhausted, but otherwise in good health. We got him a sandwich and then carried him out to be reunited with Mom and Dad.”
The video also captured Ramirez being hugged by his father, as well as him eating his food and being wrapped in a jacket.
“It was pretty clear that he had been lost and he had kind of hunkered down for the entire night,” Fresno County Sheriff’s Lt. Brandon Pursell told CNN affiliate KABC . “There’s a lot of things that could have gone really, really wrong with this one, and we got lucky, the family got lucky. The boy is very, very fortunate to be with his family.”
Missing Houston Woman Found Safe 2 Weeks After She Disappeared on Morning Walk with Her Dog Authorities had previously reported that Ramirez went missing at Huntington Lake just before 11 a.m. on Thursday.
“A family at the Rancheria Campground reported their 4-year-old boy was missing,” they stated at the time. “They had been searching for him about an hour before they called our department.”
The Fresno County Sheriff’s Search and Rescue team searched for Ramirez in the northeastern region of the lake alongside Forest Service rangers and officers from California Fish & Wildlife officers and an air support unit.
